title: Feminine font suggestions?
content:
Hi Typos!

I'm working on an identity for a e-commerce-site with the purpose of selling children’s clothes. Age 0-8 years.

Anyway, I need some inspiration/suggestions for a feminine font. The product is called "botop.dk" so the font needs to be a bit characteristic and girly ;-)

Thanks in advance!

/Henriko
author: superfetz

comments.content: try doing a search for the term "feminine" to find past threads looking for similar fonts.
Why don't you use our sponsor : the candy script! lol

It's a bit of a cliche by now but have a look at Wendy

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/wendy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/wendy/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/wendy/")
The upright but curly script [Emily](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Emily) might work.

Maybe typefaces like [FF Strada](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Strada&x=0&y=0) or [FF Cocon](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Cocon&x=0&y=0)?  
With the half-rounded terminals, without getting _too_ soft.

Although I haven't had the chance to use it yet, I've become very fond of [Odile](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/www.vllg.com/Kontour/Odile/mudTyper+Weights/) by [Sibylle Hagmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/kontour.com/), which has a 'feminine' feel without being obvious or cliched.

\>Coquette

Nice one, I'm going to file that one for possible future use.
Dollhouse is my fave when it comes to girly display stuff.

Just about any Rob Leushke script will do - they just ooze femininity

[http://www.myfonts.com/browse/person/leuschke/rob/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124231704/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/person/leuschke/rob/ "http://www.myfonts.com/browse/person/leuschke/rob/")
